}} 'Histone H2B' is one of the 5 main histone proteins involved in the structure
of chromatin in eukaryotic cells. Featuring a main globular domain and a long N
terminal tail H2B is involved with the structure of the nucleosomes of the
'beads on a string' structure.

See nucleosome, histone and chromatin.

Other histone proteins involved: H1 H2A H3 H4
